We‚Äôll also demonstrate how to configure Amazon Bedrock Guardrails to prevent the exposure of PII, medical, or financial records. This session focuses on enabling governance and reducing risk in generative AI by demonstrating how to embed compliance-first thinking into AI application design. 
Attendees will learn how AWS services can be orchestrated to classify sensitive data, enforce privacy safeguards, and comply with regulatory frameworks like GDPR. 
This is directly relevant to organizations looking to manage the risk of data exposure and apply strong governance over AI-driven systems.

Target Audience

* CISO
* Security Engineers
* Solutions Architects
* Compliance Officers
* Risk Managers
* Data Engineers
* Developers and ML Engineers

Desired outcomes

Attendees will leave with a clear understanding of architecting generative AI applications, prioritizing personal data protection, and complying with regulatory requirements.
They will gain practical knowledge on leveraging AWS services, such as Amazon Macie and Bedrock Guardrails, to classify sensitive data, enforce privacy boundaries, and meet standards like GDPR.
Beyond technical know-how, the session aims to inspire the audience to embrace ethical and responsible AI development practices.
It will show that innovation and compliance are not mutually exclusive but can‚Äîand should‚Äîgo hand in hand.
Participants will leave with a practical roadmap to build GenAI solutions that are secure and aligned with governance frameworks.

sessions.title: Unblocking Reliability: Performance & Load Testing at Scale on AWS
sessions.description: Building reliable applications in the cloud starts with understanding how they perform under pressure. In this session, we‚Äôll explore how AWS customers can integrate performance and load testing early in their development and deployment workflows to ensure system reliability under stress and other load conditions. Learn how to use open-source tools like JMeter, K6, and Locust to simulate real-world traffic at scale using AWS-native services and solutions like Fargate, ECS, and Distributed Load Testing on AWS. We‚Äôll cover best practices for testing APIs, microservices and applications across global regions, and show how performance data can drive smarter scaling, monitoring, and architecture decisions. Whether you're running on EC2, Lambda, containers, or beyond‚Äîthis session will help you build performance into your cloud-native apps from day one.

sessions.title: Automation 101
sessions.description: In this session I will show how to get started on the path to DevOps by using automation with Ansible. This session is aimed at those professionals focused on traditional infrastructure as system administrators, or for all those who want to start their DevOps journey. With simple examples and basic concepts I will teach how to use automation with Ansible to create a basic working web service on AWS.

sessions.description: Join Girish Dudhwal, Head of Cloud & SRE Practice at Wizeline, for a lightning session where you‚Äôll get an inside look at the company‚Äôs culture of innovation, current job opportunities, and the professional growth paths that make Wizeline a top destination for tech talent.
